intro: Verbascum caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian mullein, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which includes over 300 species of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. The plant features large, fuzzy, silver-green leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It produces showy yellow flowers in late summer, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Verbascum caucasicum is known for its adaptability to rocky and arid environments.
